252 × 9 – 5 + 32 ÷ 92 ?
questions.nameText:
If ‘+’ means ‘minus’, ‘×’ means ‘divided by’, ‘+’ means ‘plus’ and ‘-’ means ‘multiplied by’, then which of the following will be the value of the expression

252 × 9 – 5 + 32 ÷ 92 ?
questions.solution:
The given expression is 252 × 9 – 5 + 32 ÷ 92

Using the symbols correctly as given in the above question, the above expression becomes

252 ÷ 9 × 5 – 32 + 92

Using BODMAS RULE, we get

28 × 5 – 32 + 92 = 140 – 32 + 92 = 232 – 32 = 200

Therefore, the value of the given expression = 200

questions.name: Jitendra says, “If Rajendra gives me Rs. 40, he will have half as much as Raja, but if Raja gives me Rs. 40, then the three of us will all have the same amount”. What is the total amount of money that Jitendra, Rajendra and Raja have between them?
questions.nameText: Jitendra says, “If Rajendra gives me Rs. 40, he will have half as much as Raja, but if Raja gives me Rs. 40, then the three of us will all have the same amount”. What is the total amount of money that Jitendra, Rajendra and Raja have between them?
questions.solution:
Let money with Jitendra = Rs. x

Money with Rajendra = Rs. y

Money with Raja = Rs. z

Then, according to the question

y-40=12z ...((i)

z-40=y ...(ii)

z-40=x+40 ...(iii)

Putting the value of y from (ii) in (i), we get

z-40-40=12z

or, z=160

So, y=z-40=160-40=120.

Then, puttingh the value of z in (iii), we get

160-40=x+40

or, x=80

Therefore, the total amount of money

= Rs. (x+y+z)

= Rs. (80 + 120 + 160)

= Rs. 360.

questions.name: How many times do the hands of a clock coincide in a day?
questions.nameText: How many times do the hands of a clock coincide in a day?
questions.solution:
As we know that the hands of a clock coincide once in every hour.

So, in a period of 12 hours, the hands of a clock are coincide with each other = 11 times.

[∵ Between 11 o’clock and 1 o’clock they coincide only once]

So, the hands of a clock are coincide with each other in a day i.e. in 24 hours = (11 × 2) times = 22 times.

questions.nameText: A man said to a lady, “Your mother’s husband’s sister is my aunt”. How is the lady related to the man?
questions.solution:
Lady’s mother’s husband ⇒ Lady’s father

So, Lady’s father’s sister ⇒ Lady’s aunt [∵ Lady’s aunt ∵ man’s aunt]

Therefore, the ‘lady’ is Sister of the ‘man’.

questions.name: If ‘A $ B’ means ‘A is father of B’, ‘A # B’ means ‘A is daughter of B’, ‘A @ B’ means ‘A is sister of B’, then how is K related to M in H @ K $ L # M?
questions.nameText: If ‘A $ B’ means ‘A is father of B’, ‘A # B’ means ‘A is daughter of B’, ‘A @ B’ means ‘A is sister of B’, then how is K related to M in H @ K $ L # M?
questions.solution:
H @ K ⇒ H is sister of K.

K $ L ⇒ K is father of L.

L # M ⇒ L is daughter of M.

Therefore, ‘K’ is the husband of ‘M’

In each of the question below are given three statements followed by three conclusions numbered I, II & III. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance from commonly known facts. Read all the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusion logically follows from the given statements disregarding commonly known facts.

Statements:

Some carrots are brinjals.

Some brinjals are apples.

All apples are bananas.

Conclusions:

I. Some apples are carrots.

II. Some bananas are brinjals.

III. Some bananas are carrots.
questions.nameText:
In each of the question below are given three statements followed by three conclusions numbered I, II & III. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance from commonly known facts. Read all the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusion logically follows from the given statements disregarding commonly known facts.

Statements:

Some carrots are brinjals.

Some brinjals are apples.

All apples are bananas.



Conclusions:

I. Some apples are carrots.

II. Some bananas are brinjals.

III. Some bananas are carrots.

options.name: Only either II or III follow
options.nameText: Only either II or III follow

questions.solution:
Conclusion I:

''Some carrots are brinjals’ + ''Some brinjals are apples'' i.e. I + I ⇒ No conclusion.

Therefore, conclusion I does not follow.

Conclusion II:

''Some brinjals are apples’ + ''All apples are bananas'' i.e. I + A ⇒ I i.e. Some brinjals are bananas'' →Conversion ''Some bananas are brinjals'' i.e I-type

Therefore, conclusion II follows.

Conclusion III:

(''Some carrots are brinjals’ + ''Some brinjals are apples’) + ''All apples are bananas''

⇒ (I + I) + A ⇒ No conclusion [∵ I-type statements cannot be combined]

Therefore, conclusion III does not follow.

questions.name: Find n, if 2200-2192.31+2n is a perfect square.
questions.nameText: Find n, if 2200-2192.31+2n  is a perfect square.
questions.solution:
2200-2192.31+2n=219228-31+2n

=2192256-31+2n=2192.225+2n

∴ For some m∈n,

2n=m2-2192.225=m2-296.152

=(m-296.15)(m+296.15)

So, m-296.15=2α (say)

and m+296.15=2α+β (say)

For some negative integers α,β.

∴297∙15=2α+β-2α

⇒297∙15=2α(2β-1)

⇒297=2α and 2β-1=15

⇒α=97 and β=4

∴n=2α+β=2×97+4=198

questions.name:
If a, b and c are distinct natural numbers less than 25. What is the maximum possible value of

a-b+b-c-|c-a| |??
questions.nameText:
If a, b and c are distinct natural numbers less than 25. What is the maximum possible value of

a-b+b-c-|c-a| |??
questions.solution:
For any two points M, N on the number line representing numbersm, n the distance

MN=|m-n| |.

So, for three points P,Q and R on the number line |p-q|,|q-r|,|r-p| are distances between three pairs of points on the number line.

In this case, we are trying to find maximum value of |a-b|+|b-c|,|c-a| |. If b lies between a and c , the above value would be zero. So, b should not be between a and c .

The best case scenario would be if a , c were very close to each other and far from b .

Let us try b=24,a=1,c=2

In this case |a-b|+|b-c|-|c-a|

= 23 + 22 − 1 = 44

This is the maximum possible value

We could also have b=1,a=24,c=23 ,

a-b+b-c-c-a=23+22-1=44

questions.nameText: If x and y are integers, then the equation 5x+19y=64 has

options.nameText: no solution for x<300 and y<0
no solution for x>250 and y>-100

questions.solution:
Given, 5x+19y=64

We see that, if y=1 , we get an integer solution for x=9 . Now, if y changes (increases or decreases) by 5, x will change (decrease or increase) by 19.

Looking at options, if x=256 , we get y=64

Using these values, we see options (a), (b) and (d) are eliminated and also that there exists a solution for 250<x≤300 .

questions.name: The sum of ages of a daughter and mother is 63 yr. Four years back mother''s age was 4 times that of daughter''s age at that time. What is present age of mother?
questions.nameText: The sum of ages of a daughter and mother is 63 yr. Four years back mother''s age was 4 times that of daughter''s age at that time. What is present age of mother?
questions.solution:
Let the present age of daughter =x yr

and present age of mother =y yr

According to the question,

x+y=63 …(i)

4yr back,

Daughter’s age =(x-4) yr

Mother’s age =(y-4) yr

∴4x-4=y-4

4x-16=y-4

4x-y=12 …(ii)

From Eqs. (i) and (ii), we get

x+y=63

⇒4x-y=12

∴x=15 yr

∵x+y=63

⇒15+y=63

⇒y=48 yr

Hence, present age of mother = 48 yr.

questions.name: A watch gains 10 s in 5 min was set correct at 9.00 am. When the watch indicated 20 min past 7.00 pm in the same evening, the correct time is
questions.nameText: A watch gains 10 s in 5 min was set correct at 9.00 am. When the watch indicated 20 min past 7.00 pm in the same evening, the correct time is
questions.solution:
Time gained in 5 min =10 s

So, time gained in 60 min = 105×60

= 120 s = 2 min

So, time gained in 1 h =2 min

Time gained in 10 h = 2 × 10 min = 20 min

Now,

Present time = 7:20 pm

So, correct time is 7 pm.

questions.name: Father is aged three times more than the age of his son Rohit. After 8 yr, he would be two and a half times of Rohit''s age. After further 8 yr, how many times would he be of Rohit''s age?
questions.nameText: Father is aged three times more than the age of his son Rohit. After 8 yr, he would be two and a half times of Rohit''s age. After further 8 yr, how many times would he be of Rohit''s age?
questions.solution:
Let the present age of Rohit = x yr

and present age of Rohit ''s father =x+3x=4x yr

After 8 yr,

Rohit''s age =x+8 yr

Rohit’s father’s age =4x+8 yr

According to the question,

⇒52x+8=4x+8

⇒5x2+20=4x+8

∴x=8

i.e. Rohit age after 8 yr = 16yr

Rohit''s father age after 8 yr = 40 yr

Now, after further 8 yr

Rohit age = 16 + 8 = 24yr

Rohit''s father = 40 + 8 = 48 yr

Hence, Rohit''s father age will be two times of Rohit age.

So, the number that comes next in the series, is 125.

questions.name: For a positive integer n , let Pn denote the product of the digits of n and Sn denote the sum of the digits of n . The number of integers between 10 and 1000 for which Pn+Sn=n is
questions.nameText: For a positive integer n , let Pn  denote the product of the digits of n and Sn  denote the sum of the digits of n . The number of integers between 10 and 1000 for which Pn+Sn=n is
questions.solution:
Here, 10<n<1000

Let n be the two-digit number.

Then, n=10a+b,Pn=ab,Sn=a+b

∴ab+a+b=10a+b

⇒ab=9a

∴b=9

So, there are 9 two digit numbers, i.e. 19, 29, 39,..., 99.

Again, let n be the three-digit number.

Then, n=100a+10b+c,

Pn=a bc,Sn=a+b+c

∴abc+a+b+c=100a+10b+c

⇒abc=99a+9b⇒bc=99+9ba

But the maximum value for bc=81 and RHS is more than 99.

So, no three-digit number is possible.

Hence, required number of integers is 9.

questions.name: Ram, Shyam and Hari went out for a 100 km journey. Ram and Hari started the journey in Ram’s car at the rate of 25 km/h, while Shyam walked at 5 km/h. After sometime, Hari got off and started walking at the rate of 5 km/h and Ram went back to pick up Shyam. All three reached the destination simultaneously. What was the number of hours required for the trip?
questions.nameText: Ram, Shyam and Hari went out for a 100 km journey. Ram and Hari started the journey in Ram’s car at the rate of 25 km/h, while Shyam walked at 5 km/h. After sometime, Hari got off and started walking at the rate of 5 km/h and Ram went back to pick up Shyam. All three reached the destination simultaneously. What was the number of hours required for the trip?
questions.solution:
Let us consider AB=x,BC=y and CD=z

Since, the time taken by Ram to cover x+y+y at the speed of 25 km/h is same as the time taken by Shyam to cover x at the speed of 5 km/h, therefore

x+y+y25=x5⇒y=2x

Similarly, the time taken by Ram to cover y+y+z at the speed of 25 km/h is same as the time taken by Hari to cover z at the speed of 5 km/h, therefore

x+y+z25=z5⇒y=2z

So, we have y=2x=2z

or x:y:z=1:2:1

It implies that x=25 km, y=50 km and z=25 km

Thus, the required time =x+y+y+y+z25

=20085=8 h

questions.solution:
Sum of odd integers in the set

S=n22×3+n-1×2=n22n+4=n×(n+2)

Therefore, the average of the odd integers in the set S=n+2

Sum of even integers in the set S

=n22×2+n-1×2=n22n+2=n(n+1)

Therefore, the average of the even integers in the set S=n+1. Therefore, X-Y=n+2-n+1=1

questions.name: There are five different boxes of different unknown weights each less than 100 kg. These boxes were weighted in pairs and the weights obtained are 110, 112, 113, 114, 115, 116, 117, 118, 120 and 121 kg. What is the weight in kg of the heaviest box?
questions.nameText: There are five different boxes of different unknown weights each less than 100 kg. These boxes were weighted in pairs and the weights obtained are 110, 112, 113, 114, 115, 116, 117, 118, 120 and 121 kg. What is the weight in kg of the heaviest box?
questions.solution:
Let the weights of the five boxes, in increasing order be A, B, C, D and E

i.e. A < B < C < D < E.

Each of the boxes can be paired up with another box in a total of 4 ways.

If we sum up all the given weights, we get

4(A + B + C + D + E) = (110 + 112 + 113 + 114 + 115 + 116 + 117 + 118 + 120 + 121)

= 1156 kg

⇒ A + B + C + D + E = 289 kg ...(i)

Now, 121 kg is the sum of the weight of the boxes D and E and 110 is the sum of the weights of the boxes A and B.

i.e. A + B = 110 kg

and D + E =121 kg

∴ A + B + D + E = 231 kg ...(ii)

Subtracting Eq. (ii) from Eq. (i), we get

C = 289 – 231 = 58 kg

Now, 120 kg is the sum of the weights of the boxes C and E

i.e. C + E = 120 kg

⇒ E = (120 - 58) kg = 62 kg

questions.name: The students in three classes are in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5. If 20 students are increased in each class, the ratio changes to 4 : 5 : 7. The total number of students before the increase were
questions.nameText: The students in three classes are in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5. If 20 students are increased in each class, the ratio changes to 4 : 5 : 7. The total number of students before the increase were
questions.solution:
Let the students in three classes be 2x , 3x and 5x .

On increasing the students in each classes by 20, the students will be 2x+20,3x+20 and 5x+20 .

Now, according to the question,

2x+20:3x+20:5x+20∷4:5:7

∵2x+203x+20=45

10x+100=12x+80

x=10

Total number of students before increase were

=2x+3x+5x=10x=1010=100

questions.name:
Ajith is three times older than Babita. Chetu is half the age of Das. Babita is older than Chetu. Which of the following additional information is needed to estimate the age of Ajith?

I. Chetu is 10 yr old.

II. Both Babita and Das are older than Chetu by the same number of years.
questions.nameText:
Ajith is three times older than Babita. Chetu is half the age of Das. Babita is older than Chetu. Which of the following additional information is needed to estimate the age of Ajith?

I. Chetu is 10 yr old.

II. Both Babita and Das are older than Chetu by the same number of years.
questions.solution:
Let the ages of Ajith, Babita, Chetu, Das are A, B, C, D yr.

Age of Ajith is three times that of Babita i.e. A = 3B

Chetu is half the age of Das i.e. C=D2

Babita is older than Chetu i.e. B > C.

Statement I

Chetu is 10 yr old. This statement is necessary to find the age of Ajith.

Statement II

This statement is again necessary to find the age of Ajith.

Hence, both statements I and II are necessary to estimate the age of Ajith.
